butter_chicken.name: Butter Chicken
butter_chicken.description: A rich and creamy tomato-based chicken curry, popular in North India and known for its smooth buttery texture.
instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, turmeric, chili powder, and salt for 1 hour.
Cook chicken in a pan until golden brown. Set aside.
In another pan, heat butter and sauté onions, then add tomatoes and spices.
Blend the cooked mixture, return to pan, and add cream.
Add chicken and simmer for 15 mins. Serve hot with naan or rice.

palak_paneer.name: Palak Paneer
palak_paneer.description: A nutritious and flavorful spinach-based curry cooked with cubes of Indian cottage cheese.
instructions: Blanch spinach and blend to a paste.
Sauté onion, ginger garlic paste, and tomatoes.
Add spinach paste and spices, simmer.
Add paneer cubes and cook for 5 mins.
Serve hot with roti or rice.

masala_dosa.name: Masala Dosa
masala_dosa.description: A crisp fermented rice crepe filled with spicy mashed potatoes, a famous South Indian delicacy.
instructions: Heat oil, splutter mustard seeds, sauté onions and chilies.
Add mashed potatoes, turmeric, and salt.
Spread dosa batter on a hot tawa, drizzle oil.
Place filling in the center, fold and serve with chutney.

biryani.name: Chicken Biryani
biryani.description: A spiced rice dish layered with marinated chicken, herbs, and saffron, slow-cooked to perfection.
instructions: Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices.
Cook rice till 70% done. Fry onions.
Layer rice and chicken in pot with herbs.
Top with saffron milk and ghee.
Cook on low heat for 30 mins. Serve hot.

aloo_gobi.name: Aloo Gobi
aloo_gobi.description: A dry stir-fry made with potatoes and cauliflower, seasoned with Indian spices.
instructions: Heat oil, add cumin seeds, onions.
Add potatoes and cauliflower.
Add spices, cover and cook till soft.
Serve with roti or rice.

samosa.name: Samosa
samosa.description: A deep-fried pastry filled with spiced potatoes and peas, served as a snack.
instructions: Prepare dough with flour, oil, and water.
Sauté filling with mashed potatoes and peas.
Shape dough into cones, fill, and seal.
Deep-fry till golden brown. Serve with chutney.

rajma.name: Rajma
rajma.description: A comfort food made from red kidney beans in a thick tomato-based curry.
instructions: Soak rajma overnight and pressure cook.
Sauté onion, garlic, tomatoes and spices.
Add rajma and simmer 15 mins.
Serve hot with rice.

idli.name: Idli
idli.description: Steamed rice cakes made from fermented batter, a staple breakfast in South India.
instructions: Soak rice and dal separately and grind.
Ferment batter overnight.
Pour into idli molds and steam for 10 mins.
Serve with chutney or sambar.

poha.name: Poha
poha.description: A quick Maharashtrian breakfast made with flattened rice, peanuts, and spices.
instructions: Rinse poha and drain.
Heat oil, add mustard seeds, chilies, onions, peanuts.
Add poha, turmeric, salt and mix.
Top with lemon and serve.

paneer_tikka.name: Paneer Tikka
paneer_tikka.description: Chunks of paneer marinated in spices and grilled or baked, served with mint chutney.
instructions: Mix all spices with yogurt to make marinade.
Add paneer cubes and marinate for 1 hour.
Skewer and grill or bake until charred.
Serve with chutney.
